intro: Dubardella, commonly known as the mountain bellflower, is a genus of flowering plants in the nightshade family, Solanaceae. It is native to the Mediterranean region and parts of southern Europe, often found in rocky or mountainous habitats. The plants typically have hairy stems and produce showy, bell-shaped flowers in shades of blue, violet, or white. Dubardella species are characterized by their small, clustered leaves and their ability to thrive in well-drained soils. They are often cultivated for their ornamental value and are popular in rock gardens and alpine settings.
